Job Title: Vice President, Marketing and Communications

Location: Fairfield, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations

Description:
At NorthBay Health the Vice President of Marketing and Communications leads all strategic marketing and brand management for the organization. Manage public relations and communications functions including reputation management, media relations, marketing and public relations promotion, event management and Internet site content development. Lead all senior-level communications to internal and external audiences, including crisis communications. Serve as the organization’s senior communications advisor. 
The VP also works closely with members of all corporate Departments to ensure alignment of system-wide messaging – internally and externally – to make certain the “voice of NorthBay” reflects the organization’s brand. This individual leads a team of professionals to deliver results that enhance the reputation of NorthBay and support its strategic plan and growth goals. The VP leads the implementation of marketing initiatives, embracing and strengthening NorthBay’s image and brand, to attract and retain patients. The VP reports to the President, Foundation / Chief Experience Officer.
This position will work onsite. 
Skills and Qualifications: 
Education: Bachelor's degree in marketing, healthcare/business administration, public health or a related field is required. Master’s degree is highly preferred. 
Experience/Skills: Ten (10) or more years of experience in non-profit brand expertise, marketing and communications. Ten (10) or more years of progressive experience as a manager. Demonstrated track record building and managing marketing teams. Demonstrated leadership, facilitation, networking skills and the ability to think strategically. Demonstrated analytical and financial management skills with operating and capital budgets. Demonstrated experience with market research and current marketing technology, including CRM, digital, marketing automation and performance tracking. Ability to write creative, concise, strategically cogent, and persuasive communications. Proven experience in strategic marketing content development. Demonstrated competence in written, oral and electronic communication skills. Demonstrated change management skills.
Interpersonal Skills: Adherence to the NorthBay Way. The NorthBay Way is a set of value-based behaviors that are to be consistently demonstrated and role modeled by all employees that work at NorthBay Health. The NorthBay Way principles consist of Caring, Communication, Collaboration, and Competence.
Compensation: Annual salary range $200K - MAX $320K (MAX salary is commensurate of 20+ years experience in a VP role) Eligible for annual incentive bonus optimum achievement up to 35% of annualized salary. 



*NorthBay Health is not utilizing outside recruitment sources.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
